value:
As a strategist, it's my job to rile up
the troops. Making people happy?
That's more difficult.

So this is what a festival is like. I
never had the chance to do anything
like this when I was young.

No matter the past you carry with
you, you have a right to live your
life.

It doesn't matter if Commander Greil
happens to be alive here. Ike is the
commander of the Greil Mercenaries.

I got you a gift, but whether it's the
correct choice or not? I have no idea.

I have journeyed to you to bring
a Day of Devotion greeting from
$Nf.$k$pThere you have it. I'll leave now.

To express your feelings toward
someone... There's something to
that idea.

These clothes are more appropriate
for battle than I anticipated.

I could curse my luck, but that
would be a waste of breath.

When we return to the battlefield, I'll
prove your judgment here was not
mistaken.

I am Soren of the Greil Mercenaries.
Festivals are all well and good, but
I'd appreciate being given work to do.

When we first met, I had some
objections to your tactical decisions.$k$pIt seemed to me you directed your
troops to move in ways that they
couldn't possibly comprehend.$k$pThe results proved me wrong,
however. It's like you could see
the battlefield from on high...$k$pSince then, I've kept a close watch
on your decisions. You've given me
plenty of food for thought.$k$pI am grateful for the chance you
gave me to improve myself. Meeting
you has proven valuable.$k$pSince it's the Day of Devotion...$k$pI felt like I should at least make the
effort to express my gratitude to you.
That's it.
はぁっ！
では…
うああっ！
面倒なことを…
Here. A gift.
You can have this.
No need to be polite.
Is this to your satisfaction?
Sorry, Ike...
Umm...
I have no problem with working. I just expect to be compensated for it.
I really don't have time for your high jinks.
This gift is from...your heart? I see.
What sorts of things do I like? Well, nothing in particular.
If it's Ike you're after, I would suggest checking the food stalls. I'd start with those that serve meat.
To be able to reacquaint with someone who has died... This truly is a strange world.
I suppose I should ask what sorts of things you like in return.
Yes, I understand.
Are you lost?
Make up your mind.
